result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shawn Curtis Picotte

defendant.name: Picotte, Shawn Curtis
defendant.address: 3275 South Manor Drive, New Berlin, WI 53151

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shawn Curtis Picotte in court.  Attorney Kirk R. Emick in court for Shawn Curtis Picotte.  Attorney Francesco Mineo in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Calendar Call. Defendant appears. Court vacates the stayed warrant. Case adjourned for Motion hearing to dismiss, Branch 11.
Motion hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Shawn Curtis Picotte not in court.  Attorney Kirk R. Emick in court for Shawn Curtis Picotte.  Attorney Francesco Mineo in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ernick informed the court that the defendant is ill.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 11.
Calendar call scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Shawn Curtis Picotte in court with attorney Kirk R. Emick.  Ann Lopez for Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status conference.  Defense has not received all of discovery and requested more time.  Case scheduled for status conference.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Shawn Curtis Picotte in court with attorney Kirk R. Emick.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for Franco Mineo for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense to receive complete discovery.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 25.  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 316 of the Safety Building.  Status conference scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Shawn Curtis Picotte in court with Attorney Gaskill.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Shawn Curtis Picotte in court with Attorney Kirk R. Emick.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defense requests an adjournment for time to go over the waiver form. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Status conference scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No driving without a valid license and state required insurance.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (02-10-2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Shawn Curtis Picotte in court with attorney Gaskill who appears on behalf of attorney Kirk R. Emick  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.   Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 011220,
Payable Number: 983305,
Receipt Number: 22RP004841,
Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/8/22 @ 2:30p
